paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on a de novo missense variant in the KCNH2 gene associated with a fetal case of biventricular noncompaction cardiomyopathy and long QT syndrome.

patients.phenotype: biventricular noncompaction cardiomyopathy with pulmonary stenosis and bradycardia

individual_records.phenotype_details: biventricular noncompaction cardiomyopathy, pulmonary stenosis, second-degree 2:1 atrioventricular block, and sinus bradycardia
individual_records.evidence_sentence: We report the first prenatal case of KCNH2 mutation presenting with LVNC combined with bradycardia and second-degree 2:1 atrioventricular block.

functional_data.summary: The Tyr616Cys variant generated minimal current, suggesting altered channel permeability as a mechanism that leads to prolonged QT interval.

variants.segregation_data: The variant was de novo in the fetus; no segregation data provided for parents.
variants.population_frequency: Not found in gnomAD or in-house control database.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on ACMG guidelines and previous reports.
variants.additional_notes: The variant has been reported previously in several individuals with LQTS.
key_quotes: This KCNH2 missense mutation was classified as pathogenic according to the American College of Medical Genetics and Genomics and the Association for Molecular Pathology variant interpretation guidelines.
The variant has been reported previously in several individuals with LQTS.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
